The emergency funds are considered financial aid for students and will be disbursed to student accounts according to Ana Gagula associate director of Student Financial Aid PERIOD Photo courtesy of FAU PERIOD

Joseph Acosta Staff WriterMay  

In response to the COVID19 pandemic Florida Atlantic University has established an emergency fund for currently registered students PERIOD



The fund is for currently registered degreeseeking students experiencing financial hardship and can be used for educationrelated expenses such as room board and tuition according to an FAU statement PERIOD



According to FAU Provost Bret Danilowicz over  students have already applied PERIOD



Weve got a lot of demand among our students he said during a Board of Trustees meeting on April  PERIOD Everybody is anxious to get this into the hands of our students. the idea for the Emergency Fund came from an executive leadership meeting says Dr PERIOD Larry Faerman the acting Vice President of Student Affairs and Enrollment Management PERIOD The group was discussing the impact on students during the universitys initial twoweek closure when the Emergency Fund idea was brought up PERIOD



The students have all been impacted by the outbreak directly or indirectly PERIOD These  students have received  in donations via the Emergency Fund as of April  according to Faerman PERIOD



In order to apply for the Emergency Fund Faerman said that students must have submitted their FAFSA for the upcoming year PERIOD Once they apply the Office of Financial Aid begins to distribute money according to professional and federal guidelines PERIOD
